(a) Leilani is a control and valve installer and repairer, except mechanical door.

While option (a) seems highly improbable given Leilani's described background, it is still more probable than the conjunction of two specific conditions in option (b).

This problem illustrates the conjunction fallacy, where people tend to incorrectly judge the conjunction of specific conditions as more probable than a single general condition, due to the representativeness heuristic or the tendency to judge probability based on how well the scenario fits the available information.
